SEARCH
Module FoundationsF25_2
Package jUnitTesting

Class PostCRUDTests

java.lang.Object
jUnitTesting.PostCRUDTests
public class PostCRUDTests extends Object
Test class focused on Post CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations.

This class validates that all post-related database operations work correctly, including creation, retrieval, updating, and deletion of posts. These tests ensure the Student User Stories for post management are properly implemented.

Each test is isolated: the database is set up before each test and cleared afterwards.

Version:
1.0

  • Field Details

    • dbHelper

      private Database dbHelper
      Helper object to interact with the database during tests. A fresh instance is initialized in setup().

    • TEST_USERNAME

      private final String TEST_USERNAME
      Username used for test posts created in this class.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • PostCRUDTests

      public PostCRUDTests()
      Default constructor for PostTests. JUnit uses this constructor to create a new test instance for each test execution.

  • Method Details

    • setup

      @BeforeEach public void setup() throws SQLException
      Sets up a fresh database state before each test.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if the database setup fails

    • teardown

      @AfterEach public void teardown() throws SQLException
      Cleans the database after each test to prevent cross-test interference.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if clearing the database fails

    • testCreatePost

      @Test public void testCreatePost() throws SQLException
      ✅ Tests creating and retrieving a post from the database.

      Ensures that:

      • The post receives a valid ID
      • Inserted values (title, content, tags, owner) match retrieved values
      Throws:
      SQLException - if database access fails

    • testReadPosts

      @Test public void testReadPosts() throws SQLException
      ✅ Tests retrieval of multiple posts from different queries.

      Checks:

      • Fetching posts newest-first
      • Fetching posts created by a specific user
      Throws:
      SQLException - if database access fails

    • testUpdatePost

      @Test public void testUpdatePost() throws SQLException
      ✅ Tests updating post fields (title, subtitle, content, and tags).
      Throws:
      SQLException - if an update query fails

    • testDeletePost

      @Test public void testDeletePost() throws SQLException
      ✅ Tests deleting a post and validating it no longer exists in the database.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if deletion fails
